t: Micah 1
The*p word of the Lord*s that came to Micah of Moresheth in the days of Jotham, Ahaz, and*i Hezekiah, kings of Judah, which he saw concerning Samaria and Jerusalem.
The Coming Judgment on Israel
Hear,*pn all you peoples! Listen,*ld O earth, and all that is in it! Let*ld the Lord God*s be a witness against you, The*ld Lord from His holy temple.
For*ln behold, the Lord*s is coming out of His place; He*ld will come down And*ld tread on the high places of the earth.
The*ld mountains will melt under Him, And*ld the valleys will split Like*ld wax before the fire, Like*ld waters poured down a steep place.

All*ld this is for the transgression of Jacob And*ld for the sins of the house of Israel. What*ld is*i the transgression of Jacob? Is*ild it*i not Samaria? And*ld what are*i the high places of Judah? Are*ild they*i not Jerusalem?
“Therefore*ln I will make Samaria a heap of ruins in the field, Places*ld for planting a vineyard; I*ld will pour down her stones into the valley, And*ld I will uncover her foundations.

All*ld her carved images shall be beaten to pieces, And*ld all her pay as a harlot shall be burned with the fire; All*ld her idols I will lay desolate, For*ld she gathered it*i from the pay of a harlot, And*ld they shall return to the pay of a harlot.”
Mourning for Israel and Judah
Therefore*pn I will wail and howl, I*ld will go stripped and naked; I*ld will make a wailing like the jackals And*ld a mourning like the ostriches,
For*ld her wounds are*i incurable. For*ld it has come to Judah; It*ld has come to the gate of My people— To*ld Jerusalem.
Tell*ln it*i not in Gath, Weep*ld not at all; In*ld Beth Aphrah Roll*ld yourself in the dust.
Pass*ld by in naked shame, you inhabitant of Shaphir; The*ld inhabitant of Zaanan does not go out. Beth*ld Ezel mourns; Its*ld place to stand is taken away from you.
For*ln the inhabitant of Maroth pined for good, But*ld disaster came down from the Lord*s To*ld the gate of Jerusalem.
O*ld inhabitant of Lachish, Harness*ld the chariot to the swift steeds (She*ld was*i the beginning of sin to the daughter of Zion), For*ld the transgressions of Israel were found in you.
Therefore*ln you shall give presents to Moresheth Gath; The*ld houses of Achzib shall*i be*i a lie to the kings of Israel.
I*ld will yet bring an heir to you, O inhabitant of Mareshah; The*ld glory of Israel shall come to Adullam.
Make*ld yourself bald and cut off your hair, Because*ld of your precious children; Enlarge*ld your baldness like an eagle, For*ld they shall go from you into captivity.
Micah 2
Woe to Evildoers
Woe*pn to those who devise iniquity, And*ld work out evil on their beds! At*ld morning light they practice it, Because*ld it is in the power of their hand.
They*ld covet fields and take them*i by violence, Also*ld houses, and seize them.*i So*ld they oppress a man and his house, A*ld man and his inheritance.
Therefore*p thus says the Lord:*s “Behold,*pn against this family I am devising disaster, From*ld which you cannot remove your necks; Nor*ld shall you walk haughtily, For*ld this is*i an evil time.

In*ld that day one*i shall take up a proverb against you, And*ld lament with a bitter lamentation, saying: ‘We*ld are utterly destroyed! He*ld has changed the heritage of my people; How*ld He has removed it*i from me! To*ld a turncoat He has divided our fields.’”
Therefore*ln you will have no one to determine boundaries by lot In*ld the assembly of the Lord.*s
Lying Prophets
“Do*pn not prattle,” you*i say*i to*i those*i who prophesy. So*ld they shall not prophesy to you; They*ld shall not return insult for insult.
You*ild who*i are*i named the house of Jacob: “Is*ld the Spirit of the Lord*s restricted? Are*ild these His doings? Do*ld not My words do good To*ld him who walks uprightly?
“Lately*ln My people have risen up as an enemy— You*ld pull off the robe with the garment From*ld those who trust you,*i as they pass by, Like*ld men returned from war.
The*ld women of My people you cast out From*ld their pleasant houses; From*ld their children You*ld have taken away My glory forever.
“Arise*ln and depart, For*ld this is*i not your*i rest; Because*ld it is defiled, it shall destroy, Yes,*ld with utter destruction.
If*ld a man should walk in a false spirit And*ld speak a lie, saying,*i ‘I*ld will prophesy to you of wine and drink,’ Even*ld he would be the prattler of this people.
Israel Restored

“I*pn will surely assemble all of you, O Jacob, I*ld will surely gather the remnant of Israel; I*ld will put them together like sheep of the fold, Like*ld a flock in the midst of their pasture; They*ld shall make a loud noise because of so*i many*i people.
The*ld one who breaks open will come up before them; They*ld will break out, Pass*ld through the gate, And*ld go out by it; Their*ld king will pass before them, With*ld the Lord*s at their head.”
Micah 3
Wicked Rulers and Prophets
And*p I said: “Hear*pn now, O heads of Jacob, And*ld you rulers of the house of Israel: Is*ild it*i not for you to know justice?
You*ld who hate good and love evil; Who*ld strip the skin from My people, And*ld the flesh from their bones;
Who*ld also eat the flesh of My people, Flay*ld their skin from them, Break*ld their bones, And*ld chop them*i in pieces Like*ld meat*i for the pot, Like*ld flesh in the caldron.”
Then*ln they will cry to the Lord,*s But*ld He will not hear them; He*ld will even hide His face from them at that time, Because*ld they have been evil in their deeds.

Thus*ln says the Lord*s concerning the prophets Who*ld make my people stray; Who*ld chant “Peace” While*ld they chew with their teeth, But*ld who prepare war against him Who*ld puts nothing into their mouths:
“Therefore*ld you shall have night without vision, And*ld you shall have darkness without divination; The*ld sun shall go down on the prophets, And*ld the day shall be dark for them.
So*ld the seers shall be ashamed, And*ld the diviners abashed; Indeed*ld they shall all cover their lips; For*ld there*i is*i no answer from God.”
But*ln truly I am full of power by the Spirit of the Lord,*s And*ld of justice and might, To*ld declare to Jacob his transgression And*ld to Israel his sin.
Now*ld hear this, You*ld heads of the house of Jacob And*ld rulers of the house of Israel, Who*ld abhor justice And*ld pervert all equity,
Who*ld build up Zion with bloodshed And*ld Jerusalem with iniquity:

Her*ld heads judge for a bribe, Her*ld priests teach for pay, And*ld her prophets divine for money. Yet*ld they lean on the Lord,*s and say, “Is*ld not the Lord*s among us? No*ld harm can come upon us.”
Therefore*ld because of you Zion*ld shall be plowed like*i a field, Jerusalem*ld shall become heaps of ruins, And*ld the mountain of the temple Like*ld the bare hills of the forest.
Micah 4
The Lord’s Reign in Zion

Now*pn it shall come to pass in the latter days That*ild the mountain of the Lord’s*s house Shall*ld be established on the top of the mountains, And*ld shall be exalted above the hills; And*ld peoples shall flow to it.

Many*ld nations shall come and say, “Come,*ld and let us go up to the mountain of the Lord,*s To*ld the house of the God of Jacob; He*ld will teach us His ways, And*ld we shall walk in His paths.” For*ld out of Zion the law shall go forth, And*ld the word of the Lord*s from Jerusalem.

He*ld shall judge between many peoples, And*ld rebuke strong nations afar off; They*ld shall beat their swords into plowshares, And*ld their spears into pruning hooks; Nation*ld shall not lift up sword against nation, Neither*ld shall they learn war anymore.
But*ln everyone shall sit under his vine and under his fig tree, And*ld no one shall make them*i afraid; For*ld the mouth of the Lord*s of hosts has spoken.
For*ld all people walk each in the name of his god, But*ld we will walk in the name of the Lord*s our God Forever*ld and ever.
Zion’s Future Triumph
“In*pn that day,” says the Lord,*s “I*ld will assemble the lame, I*ld will gather the outcast And*ld those whom I have afflicted;
I*ld will make the lame a remnant, And*ld the outcast a strong nation; So*ld the Lord*s will reign over them in Mount Zion From*ld now on, even forever.
And*ld you, O tower of the flock, The*ld stronghold of the daughter of Zion, To*ld you shall it come, Even*ld the former dominion shall come, The*ld kingdom of the daughter of Jerusalem.”
Now*ln why do you cry aloud? Is*ild there*i no king in your midst? Has*ld your counselor perished? For*ld pangs have seized you like a woman in labor.

Be*ld in pain, and labor to bring forth, O*ld daughter of Zion, Like*ld a woman in birth pangs. For*ld now you shall go forth from the city, You*ld shall dwell in the field, And*ld to Babylon you shall go. There*ld you shall be delivered; There*ld the Lord*s will redeem you From*ld the hand of your enemies.
Now*ln also many nations have gathered against you, Who*ld say, “Let her be defiled, And*ld let our eye look upon Zion.”
But*ld they do not know the thoughts of the Lord,*s Nor*ld do they understand His counsel; For*ld He will gather them like sheaves to the threshing floor.

“Arise*ln and thresh, O daughter of Zion; For*ld I will make your horn iron, And*ld I will make your hooves bronze; You*ld shall beat in pieces many peoples; I*ld will consecrate their gain to the Lord,*s And*ld their substance to the Lord of the whole earth.”
Micah 5
Now*pn gather yourself in troops, O*ld daughter of troops; He*ld has laid siege against us; They*ld will strike the judge of Israel with a rod on the cheek.
The Coming Messiah

“But*pn you, Bethlehem Ephrathah, Though*ild you are little among the thousands of Judah, Yet*ild out of you shall come forth to Me The*ld One to be Ruler in Israel, Whose*ld goings forth are*i from of old, From*ld everlasting.”
Therefore*ln He shall give them up, Until*ld the time that*i she who is in labor has given birth; Then*ld the remnant of His brethren Shall*ld return to the children of Israel.

And*ld He shall stand and feed His*i flock*i In*ld the strength of the Lord,*s In*ld the majesty of the name of the Lord*s His God; And*ld they shall abide, For*ld now He shall be great To*ld the ends of the earth;
And*ld this One*i shall be peace.
Judgment on Israel’s Enemies
When*pn the Assyrian comes into our land, And*ld when he treads in our palaces, Then*ld we will raise against him Seven*ld shepherds and eight princely men.

They*ld shall waste with the sword the land of Assyria, And*ld the land of Nimrod at its entrances; Thus*ld He shall deliver us*i from the Assyrian, When*ld he comes into our land And*ld when he treads within our borders.
Then*ln the remnant of Jacob Shall*ld be in the midst of many peoples, Like*ld dew from the Lord,*s Like*ld showers on the grass, That*ld tarry for no man Nor*ld wait for the sons of men.

And*ld the remnant of Jacob Shall*ld be among the Gentiles, In*ld the midst of many peoples, Like*ld a lion among the beasts of the forest, Like*ld a young lion among flocks of sheep, Who,*ld if he passes through, Both*ld treads down and tears in pieces, And*ld none can deliver.
Your*ld hand shall be lifted against your adversaries, And*ld all your enemies shall be cut off.
“And*ln it shall be in that day,” says the Lord,*s “That*ld I will cut off your horses from your midst And*ld destroy your chariots.
I*ld will cut off the cities of your land And*ld throw down all your strongholds.
I*ld will cut off sorceries from your hand, And*ld you shall have no soothsayers.
Your*ld carved images I will also cut off, And*ld your sacred*i pillars from your midst; You*ld shall no more worship the work of your hands;
I*ld will pluck your wooden images from your midst; Thus*ld I will destroy your cities.
And*ld I will execute vengeance in anger and fury On*ld the nations that have not heard.”
Micah 6
God Pleads with Israel
Hear*p now what the Lord*s says: “Arise,*pn plead your case before the mountains, And*ld let the hills hear your voice.
Hear,*ld O you mountains, the Lord’s*s complaint, And*ld you strong foundations of the earth; For*ld the Lord*s has a complaint against His people, And*ld He will contend with Israel.
“O*ln My people, what have I done to you? And*ld how have I wearied you? Testify*ld against Me.
For*ld I brought you up from the land of Egypt, I*ld redeemed you from the house of bondage; And*ld I sent before you Moses, Aaron, and Miriam.

O*ld My people, remember now What*ld Balak king of Moab counseled, And*ld what Balaam the son of Beor answered him, From*ld Acacia Grove to Gilgal, That*ld you may know the righteousness of the Lord.”*s
With*ln what shall I come before the Lord,*s And*ild bow myself before the High God? Shall*ld I come before Him with burnt offerings, With*ld calves a year old?
Will*ld the Lord*s be pleased with thousands of rams, Ten*ld thousand rivers of oil? Shall*ld I give my firstborn for*i my transgression, The*ld fruit of my body for*i the sin of my soul?
He*ln has shown you, O man, what is*i good; And*ld what does the Lord*s require of you But*ld to do justly, To*ld love mercy, And*ld to walk humbly with your God?
Punishment of Israel’s Injustice
The*pn Lord’s*s voice cries to the city— Wisdom*ld shall see Your name: “Hear*ln the rod! Who*ld has appointed it?
Are*ld there yet the treasures of wickedness In*ld the house of the wicked, And*ld the short measure that*i is*i an abomination?
Shall*ld I count pure those*i with the wicked scales, And*ld with the bag of deceitful weights?
For*ld her rich men are full of violence, Her*ld inhabitants have spoken lies, And*ld their tongue is deceitful in their mouth.
“Therefore*ld I will also make you*i sick by striking you, By*ld making you*i desolate because of your sins.
You*ld shall eat, but not be satisfied; Hunger*ld shall*i be*i in your midst. You*ld may carry some*i away, but shall not save them;*i And*ld what you do rescue I will give over to the sword.
“You*ln shall sow, but not reap; You*ld shall tread the olives, but not anoint yourselves with oil; And*ld make*i sweet wine, but not drink wine.

For*ld the statutes of Omri are kept; All*ld the works of Ahab’s house are*i done;*i And*ld you walk in their counsels, That*ld I may make you a desolation, And*ld your inhabitants a hissing. Therefore*ld you shall bear the reproach of My people.”
Micah 7
Sorrow for Israel’s Sins
Woe*pn is me! For*ld I am like those who gather summer fruits, Like*ld those who glean vintage grapes; There*ild is*i no*i cluster to eat Of*ld the first-ripe fruit which*i my soul desires.
The*ld faithful man*i has perished from the earth, And*ld there*i is*i no one upright among men. They*ld all lie in wait for blood; Every*ld man hunts his brother with a net.
That*ln they may successfully do evil with both hands— The*ld prince asks for*i gifts,*i The*ld judge seeks*i a bribe, And*ld the great man*i utters his evil desire; So*ld they scheme together.
The*ld best of them is*i like a brier; The*ld most upright is*i sharper*i than a thorn hedge; The*ld day of your watchman and your punishment comes; Now*ld shall be their perplexity.
Do*ln not trust in a friend; Do*ld not put your confidence in a companion; Guard*ld the doors of your mouth From*ld her who lies in your bosom.
For*ld son dishonors father, Daughter*ld rises against her mother, Daughter-in-law*ld against her mother-in-law; A*ld man’s enemies are*i the men of his own household.
Therefore*ld I will look to the Lord;*s I*ld will wait for the God of my salvation; My*ld God will hear me.
Israel’s Confession and Comfort
Do*pn not rejoice over me, my enemy; When*ld I fall, I will arise; When*ld I sit in darkness, The*ld Lord*s will*i be*i a light to me.

I*ld will bear the indignation of the Lord,*s Because*ld I have sinned against Him, Until*ld He pleads my case And*ld executes justice for me. He*ld will bring me forth to the light; I*ld will see His righteousness.

Then*ld she*i who*i is*i my enemy will see, And*ld shame will cover her who said to me, “Where*ld is the Lord*s your God?” My*ld eyes will see her; Now*ld she will be trampled down Like*ld mud in the streets.
In*iln the day when your walls are to be built, In*ild that day the decree shall go far and wide.
In*ild that day they shall come to you From*ld Assyria and the fortified cities, From*ld the fortress to the River, From*ld sea to sea, And*ld mountain to*i mountain.
Yet*ld the land shall be desolate Because*ld of those who dwell in it, And*ld for the fruit of their deeds.
God Will Forgive Israel

Shepherd*pn Your people with Your staff, The*ld flock of Your heritage, Who*ld dwell solitarily in*i a woodland, In*ld the midst of Carmel; Let*ld them feed in*i Bashan and Gilead, As*ld in days of old.
“As*ln in the days when you came out of the land of Egypt, I*ld will show them wonders.”
The*ln nations shall see and be ashamed of all their might; They*ld shall put their*i hand over their*i mouth; Their*ld ears shall be deaf.
They*ld shall lick the dust like a serpent; They*ld shall crawl from their holes like snakes of the earth. They*ld shall be afraid of the Lord*s our God, And*ld shall fear because of You.
Who*ln is*i a God like You, Pardoning*ld iniquity And*ld passing over the transgression of the remnant of His heritage? He*ln does not retain His anger forever, Because*ld He delights in*i mercy.
He*ld will again have compassion on us, And*ld will subdue our iniquities. You*ln will cast all our sins Into*ld the depths of the sea.
You*ld will give truth to Jacob And*ild mercy to Abraham, Which*ld You have sworn to our fathers From*ld days of old.
